section_body:
[![Image 9](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b1/Joss_Whedon_by_Gage_Skidmore_7.jpg/250px-Joss_Whedon_by_Gage_Skidmore_7.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Joss_Whedon_by_Gage_Skidmore_7.jpg)

[Joss Whedon](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joss_Whedon "Joss Whedon") was a significant contributor to the MCU's Phase Two: he offered creative insight to all of the films; launched the first MCU television series, _Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D._; and wrote and directed the crossover film _Avengers: Age of Ultron_.

In November 2016, Feige explained that the studio would often put together a "lookbook" of influences from the comics and art by Marvel's visual development department, to create a visual template for a project. These are put together at company retreats, which the studio holds approximately every 18 months to plan out future projects and develop the phases of the MCU. However, these lookbooks are not always shown to directors, with Marvel sometimes preferring to let the director offer their own ideas first.[[105]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-FeigeRetreats-105) When choosing a director for a project, Marvel Studios looks for filmmakers to hire who can guide a film.[[106]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-FastCompany-106) Some of their choices for directors have been considered "out-of-left-field" based on those directors' previous work. On this, Feige remarked that "you don't have to have directed a big, giant visual-effects movie to do a big, giant visual-effects movie for us. You just have to have done something singularly sort of awesome."[[107]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-ChooseDirector-107)

The studio ensures directors are open to the idea of the shared universe and are willing to include connective material, such as [Kenneth Branagh](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kenneth_Branagh "Kenneth Branagh") and [Joe Johnston](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joe_Johnston "Joe Johnston") needing to include scenes that set-up _[The Avengers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The\_Avengers\_(2012\_film) "The Avengers (2012 film)")_ (2012) in their respective Phase One films _[Thor](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thor\_(film) "Thor (film)")_ and _[Captain America: The First Avenger](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Captain\_America:\_The\_First\_Avenger "Captain America: The First Avenger")_ (both 2011).[[5]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-BostonApril2012-5) Marvel Studios usually has a big idea they would like to explore or build to in a project, such as [Hydra](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hydra_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Hydra (Marvel Cinematic Universe)") infiltrating [S.H.I.E.L.D.](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/S.H.I.E.L.D._(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "S.H.I.E.L.D. (Marvel Cinematic Universe)") in _[Captain America: The Winter Soldier](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Captain\_America:\_The\_Winter\_Soldier "Captain America: The Winter Soldier")_ (2014), but they leave it up to the filmmakers to interpret and "improv a little bit" to get that point.[[108]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-RussosCrave-108) After these ideas have been developed, the creative team then begins exploring ideas from other future projects to see how to make any larger universe connections.[[109]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-RussosDirectingProcess-109) For many of their early films, Feige was closely involved during a film's development before allowing filming to be overseen by lower-level studio executives. Feige would then become involved again during editing, when films could be entirely rewritten or reworked.[[41]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-WSJMay2025-41) Feige described the company's approach as "plus-ing at every turn", where they are always trying to improve a project and include new suggestions rather than sticking to a set script. Feige said they would not start a film without a full script, but he was never satisfied with their scripts or finished films and always felt they could do better.[[54]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-FeigeConferenceJul2025THR-54)

In August 2012, Marvel signed _The Avengers_ and _[Avengers: Age of Ultron](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:\_Age\_of\_Ultron "Avengers: Age of Ultron")_ (2015) director [Joss Whedon](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joss_Whedon "Joss Whedon") to an exclusive contract through June 2015 for film and television. With the deal, Whedon contributed creatively to all of the Phase Two films and also developed _Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D._, the first television series set in the MCU.[[110]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-WhedonConsultDeal-110) In April 2017, _[Guardians of the Galaxy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Guardians\_of\_the\_Galaxy\_(film) "Guardians of the Galaxy (film)")_ (2014) and _[Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Guardians\_of\_the\_Galaxy\_Vol.\_2 "Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 2")_ (2017) writer and director [James Gunn](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_Gunn "James Gunn") revealed that he would be working with Marvel to help plan future stories for the [Guardians of the Galaxy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Guardians_of_the_Galaxy_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Guardians of the Galaxy (Marvel Cinematic Universe)") characters and the wider "Marvel Cosmic Universe",[[111]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-GunnVol3Confirm-111) although Gunn became the co-CEO of [DC Studios](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/DC_Studios "DC Studios") in November 2022 and signed a four-year deal to work exclusively on [DC Comics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/DC_Comics "DC Comics")-based projects.[[112]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-GunnSafranDCStudios-112) For Phase Three, there was a large amount of collaboration between the filmmakers of the individual character films and the filmmakers of the crossover films _Avengers: Infinity War_ and _Avengers: Endgame_, which were directed by the [Russo brothers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russo_brothers "Russo brothers") and written by [Christopher Markus and Stephen McFeely](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Christopher_Markus_and_Stephen_McFeely "Christopher Markus and Stephen McFeely"). This was to ensure their storytelling aligned for the Infinity Saga's culmination.[[113]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-RussosWritersPhase3-113)

Marvel Studios began contracting their actors for multiple films, including signing actor [Samuel L. Jackson](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Samuel_L._Jackson "Samuel L. Jackson") to a then-unprecedented nine-film contract.[[114]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-THRFeb2009-114) Feige said the studio had all actors sign contracts for multiple films, with the normal number being for three or more, while the nine or twelve-film deals were rare.[[115]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-FeigeContracts-115) The actors' contracts also feature clauses that allow Marvel to use up to three minutes of an actor's performance from one film in another, which Marvel describes as "bridging material".[[19]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-CreativeCommittee2-19) By the start of Phase Four, Marvel Studios was no longer contracting actors for a large number of projects, with deal lengths varying for each actor and project. Feige said the studio was looking for actors who were excited to join the franchise and appear in multiple projects without being locked into contractual obligations. He also noted that they were starting to include theme park attractions in actors' deals.[[116]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-ActorContractsJuly2021-116) By December 2020, because of the [impact COVID-19 had on theaters](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Impact_of_the_COVID-19_pandemic_on_cinema#Exhibitors "Impact of the COVID-19 pandemic on cinema") and film studios shifting away from theatrical releases, Marvel Studios began exploring updated contracts for actors, writers, directors, and producers to receive adjusted compensation in the event a film had to debut on Disney+ instead of in theaters. _[TheWrap](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/TheWrap "TheWrap")_ reported that the new contracts would likely only apply to films about to enter production.[[117]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-WrapNewContractsDec2020-117)

For Marvel Television, Loeb said he and his executives were involved in all aspects of production: "whether it's being in the writers' room, editing, on set, casting—every step of the production goes through the Marvel team to tell the best story that we can". He said the studio was able to work on so many series across different networks and platforms because all they needed was one person working on each series to help "guide the process".[[118]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-LoebJul2017-118) When developing the crossover miniseries _The Defenders_, showrunner Marco Ramirez consulted with the creators of all the individual Marvel Netflix series, having them read each of the scripts for _The Defenders_ and provide insight into individual characters' worlds.[[119]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-RamirezEWJan2017-119) Actors appearing in Marvel Television series, such as [Charlie Cox](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charlie_Cox "Charlie Cox") (who portrayed [Matt Murdock / Daredevil](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Matt_Murdock_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Matt Murdock (Marvel Cinematic Universe)") in _Daredevil_) and [Adrianne Palicki](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Adrianne_Palicki "Adrianne Palicki") ([Bobbi Morse / Mockingbird](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bobbi_Morse_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Bobbi Morse (Marvel Cinematic Universe)") in _Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D._), were contractually obliged to appear in a Marvel Studios film if asked.[[120]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-CoxFilms-120)[[121]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-PalickiFilms-121)[[122]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-PalickiFilms2-122) In December 2021, Feige confirmed that Cox would reprise the role of Daredevil in Marvel Studios MCU productions,[[123]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-CoxMarvelStudios-123) with Cox first reprising the role in the film _[Spider-Man: No Way Home](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spider-Man:\_No\_Way\_Home "Spider-Man: No Way Home")_ (2021). Additionally, [Vincent D'Onofrio](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vincent_D%27Onofrio "Vincent D'Onofrio") first reprised his role as [Wilson Fisk / Kingpin](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wilson_Fisk_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Wilson Fisk (Marvel Cinematic Universe)") from _Daredevil_ in the Disney+ series _[Hawkeye](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hawkeye\_(miniseries) "Hawkeye (miniseries)")_ (2021).[[124]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-D'OnofrioCoxReprise-124)

(Marvel Cinematic Universe)") in _[Captain America: The Winter Soldier](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Captain\_America:\_The\_Winter\_Soldier "Captain America: The Winter Soldier")_ (2014), but they leave it up to the filmmakers to interpret and "improv a little bit" to get that point.[[108]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-RussosCrave-108)

triples.sentence: Feige said they would not start a film without a full script, but he was never satisfied with their scripts or finished films and always felt they could do better.[[54]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-FeigeConferenceJul2025THR-54)
triples.statement: Kevin Feige stated that while they require a full script to start a film, he was never satisfied with the scripts or the final movies, always believing there was room for improvement.

triples.sentence: In August 2012, Marvel signed _The Avengers_ and _[Avengers: Age of Ultron](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Age_of_Ultron "Avengers: Age of Ultron")_ (2015) director [Joss Whedon](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joss_Whedon "Joss Whedon") to an exclusive contract through June 2015 for film and television.[[110]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-WhedonConsultDeal-110)
triples.statement: In August 2012, Marvel signed Joss Whedon, director of "The Avengers" and "Avengers: Age of Ultron," to an exclusive film and television contract valid through June 2015.

triples.sentence: With the deal, Whedon contributed creatively to all of the Phase Two films and also developed _Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D._, the first television series set in the MCU.[[110]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-WhedonConsultDeal-110)
triples.statement: Under this deal, Whedon provided creative contributions to all Phase Two films and developed "Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D.", the first television series in the MCU.

triples.sentence: In April 2017, _[Guardians of the Galaxy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Guardians_of_the_Galaxy_(film) "Guardians of the Galaxy (film)")_ (2014) and _[Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Guardians_of_the_Galaxy_Vol._2 "Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 2")_ (2017) writer and director [James Gunn](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_Gunn "James Gunn") revealed that he would be working with Marvel to help plan future stories for the [Guardians of the Galaxy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Guardians_of_the_Galaxy_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Guardians of the Galaxy (Marvel Cinematic Universe)") characters and the wider "Marvel Cosmic Universe",[[111]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-GunnVol3Confirm-111) although Gunn became the co-CEO of [DC Studios](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/DC_Studios "DC Studios") in November 2022 and signed a four-year deal to work exclusively on [DC Comics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/DC_Comics "DC Comics")-based projects.[[112]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-GunnSafranDCStudios-112)
triples.statement: In April 2017, writer-director James Gunn stated he would collaborate with Marvel on future stories for the Guardians of the Galaxy and the "Marvel Cosmic Universe," though he later became co-CEO of DC Studios in November 2022 with an exclusive deal for DC projects.

triples.sentence: This was to ensure their storytelling aligned for the Infinity Saga's culmination.[[113]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-RussosWritersPhase3-113)
triples.statement: This collaboration was done to ensure the storytelling was aligned for the conclusion of the Infinity Saga.

triples.sentence: Marvel Studios began contracting their actors for multiple films, including signing actor [Samuel L. Jackson](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Samuel_L._Jackson "Samuel L. Jackson") to a then-unprecedented nine-film contract.[[114]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-THRFeb2009-114)
triples.statement: Marvel Studios started signing actors to multi-film contracts, which included an unprecedented nine-film deal for Samuel L. Jackson.

triples.sentence: Feige said the studio had all actors sign contracts for multiple films, with the normal number being for three or more, while the nine or twelve-film deals were rare.[[115]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-FeigeContracts-115)
triples.statement: Kevin Feige stated that all actors signed multi-film contracts, typically for three or more films, with nine or twelve-film deals being rare.

triples.sentence: The actors' contracts also feature clauses that allow Marvel to use up to three minutes of an actor's performance from one film in another, which Marvel describes as "bridging material".[[19]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-CreativeCommittee2-19)
triples.statement: Actor contracts contain clauses that permit Marvel to use up to three minutes of a performance from one film in another, which is termed "bridging material."

triples.sentence: Feige said the studio was looking for actors who were excited to join the franchise and appear in multiple projects without being locked into contractual obligations.[[116]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-ActorContractsJuly2021-116)
triples.statement: Kevin Feige mentioned that the studio was seeking actors who were enthusiastic about joining the franchise for multiple projects without being bound by contractual obligations.

triples.sentence: He also noted that they were starting to include theme park attractions in actors' deals.[[116]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-ActorContractsJuly2021-116)
triples.statement: Feige also noted that theme park attractions were beginning to be included in actors' contracts.

triples.sentence: _[TheWrap](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/TheWrap "TheWrap")_ reported that the new contracts would likely only apply to films about to enter production.[[117]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-WrapNewContractsDec2020-117)
triples.statement: TheWrap reported that these new contracts would likely only be for films that were about to begin production.

triples.sentence: He said the studio was able to work on so many series across different networks and platforms because all they needed was one person working on each series to help "guide the process".[[118]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-LoebJul2017-118)
triples.statement: Jeph Loeb explained that the studio could manage numerous series on different platforms by assigning one person to "guide the process" for each show.

triples.sentence: When developing the crossover miniseries _The Defenders_, showrunner Marco Ramirez consulted with the creators of all the individual Marvel Netflix series, having them read each of the scripts for _The Defenders_ and provide insight into individual characters' worlds.[[119]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-RamirezEWJan2017-119)
triples.statement: While developing "The Defenders," showrunner Marco Ramirez consulted with the creators of the individual Marvel Netflix series, who reviewed scripts and provided insights on their characters.

triples.sentence: Actors appearing in Marvel Television series, such as [Charlie Cox](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charlie_Cox "Charlie Cox") (who portrayed [Matt Murdock / Daredevil](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Matt_Murdock_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Matt Murdock (Marvel Cinematic Universe)") in _Daredevil_) and [Adrianne Palicki](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Adrianne_Palicki "Adrianne Palicki") ([Bobbi Morse / Mockingbird](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bobbi_Morse_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Bobbi Morse (Marvel Cinematic Universe)") in _Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D._), were contractually obliged to appear in a Marvel Studios film if asked.[[120]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-CoxFilms-120)[[121]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-PalickiFilms-121)[[122]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-PalickiFilms2-122)
triples.statement: Actors in Marvel Television series like Charlie Cox (Daredevil) and Adrianne Palicki (Mockingbird) were contractually obligated to appear in a Marvel Studios film if requested.

triples.sentence: In December 2021, Feige confirmed that Cox would reprise the role of Daredevil in Marvel Studios MCU productions,[[123]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-CoxMarvelStudios-123) with Cox first reprising the role in the film _[Spider-Man: No Way Home](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spider-Man:_No_Way_Home "Spider-Man: No Way Home")_ (2021).
triples.statement: In December 2021, Kevin Feige confirmed Charlie Cox would return as Daredevil in Marvel Studios MCU productions, with his first appearance being in "Spider-Man: No Way Home" (2021).

triples.sentence: Additionally, [Vincent D'Onofrio](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vincent_D%27Onofrio "Vincent D'Onofrio") first reprised his role as [Wilson Fisk / Kingpin](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wilson_Fisk_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Wilson Fisk (Marvel Cinematic Universe)") from _Daredevil_ in the Disney+ series _[Hawkeye](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hawkeye_(miniseries) "Hawkeye (miniseries)")_ (2021).[[124]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-D'OnofrioCoxReprise-124)
triples.statement: Vincent D'Onofrio also reprised his role as Wilson Fisk / Kingpin from "Daredevil" in the Disney+ series "Hawkeye" (2021).

section_body:
For a more comprehensive list, see [List of Marvel Cinematic Universe films](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_Marvel_Cinematic_Universe_films "List of Marvel Cinematic Universe films").

Marvel Studios releases its films in groups called "Phases",[[12]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-DailyDotPhases-12)[[13]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-DigitalSpyPhases-13) with three phases making up a "Saga".[[59]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-FeigeConferenceJul2025TotalFilm-59)

triples.sentence: Marvel Studios releases its films in groups called "Phases",[[12]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-DailyDotPhases-12)[[13]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-DigitalSpyPhases-13) with three phases making up a "Saga".[[59]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-FeigeConferenceJul2025TotalFilm-59)
triples.statement: Marvel Studios releases its films in groups called "Phases", with three phases making up a "Saga".

section_body:
Further information: [Marvel Cinematic Universe: Phase One](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe:_Phase_One "Marvel Cinematic Universe: Phase One"), [Phase Two](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe:_Phase_Two "Marvel Cinematic Universe: Phase Two"), and [Phase Three](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe:_Phase_Three "Marvel Cinematic Universe: Phase Three")

The first three phases are collectively known as "The Infinity Saga".[[22]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-FFHInfinitySaga-22)[Phase One](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe:_Phase_One "Marvel Cinematic Universe: Phase One") consists of _[Iron Man](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iron\_Man\_(2008\_film) "Iron Man (2008 film)")_ (2008), _[The Incredible Hulk](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The\_Incredible\_Hulk\_(film) "The Incredible Hulk (film)")_ (2008), _[Iron Man 2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iron\_Man\_2 "Iron Man 2")_ (2010), _[Thor](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thor\_(film) "Thor (film)")_ (2011), and _[Captain America: The First Avenger](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Captain\_America:\_The\_First\_Avenger "Captain America: The First Avenger")_ (2011), and concludes with the [crossover](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fictional_crossover "Fictional crossover") film _[The Avengers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The\_Avengers\_(2012\_film) "The Avengers (2012 film)")_ (2012). [Phase Two](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe:_Phase_Two "Marvel Cinematic Universe: Phase Two") comprises _[Iron Man 3](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iron\_Man\_3 "Iron Man 3")_ (2013), _[Thor: The Dark World](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thor:\_The\_Dark\_World "Thor: The Dark World")_ (2013), _[Captain America: The Winter Soldier](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Captain\_America:\_The\_Winter\_Soldier "Captain America: The Winter Soldier")_ (2014), _[Guardians of the Galaxy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Guardians\_of\_the\_Galaxy\_(film) "Guardians of the Galaxy (film)")_ (2014), _[Avengers: Age of Ultron](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:\_Age\_of\_Ultron "Avengers: Age of Ultron")_ (2015), and _[Ant-Man](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ant-Man\_(film) "Ant-Man (film)")_ (2015). _[Captain America: Civil War](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Captain\_America:\_Civil\_War "Captain America: Civil War")_ (2016) is the first film of [Phase Three](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe:_Phase_Three "Marvel Cinematic Universe: Phase Three"), and is followed by _[Doctor Strange](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Doctor\_Strange\_(2016\_film) "Doctor Strange (2016 film)")_ (2016), _[Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Guardians\_of\_the\_Galaxy\_Vol.\_2 "Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 2")_ (2017), _[Spider-Man: Homecoming](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spider-Man:\_Homecoming "Spider-Man: Homecoming")_ (2017), _[Thor: Ragnarok](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thor:\_Ragnarok "Thor: Ragnarok")_ (2017), _[Black Panther](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Black\_Panther\_(film) "Black Panther (film)")_ (2018), _[Avengers: Infinity War](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:\_Infinity\_War "Avengers: Infinity War")_ (2018), _[Ant-Man and the Wasp](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ant-Man\_and\_the\_Wasp "Ant-Man and the Wasp")_ (2018), _[Captain Marvel](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Captain\_Marvel\_(film) "Captain Marvel (film)")_ (2019), _[Avengers: Endgame](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:\_Endgame "Avengers: Endgame")_ (2019), and _[Spider-Man: Far From Home](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spider-Man:\_Far\_From\_Home "Spider-Man: Far From Home")_ (2019).[[13]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-DigitalSpyPhases-13)

triples.sentence: The first three phases are collectively known as "The Infinity Saga".[[22]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-FFHInfinitySaga-22)
triples.statement: The first three phases of the Marvel Cinematic Universe are collectively known as "The Infinity Saga".

triples.sentence: _[Captain America: Civil War](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Captain\_America:_Civil\_War "Captain America: Civil War")_ (2016) is the first film of [Phase Three](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe:_Phase_Three "Marvel Cinematic Universe: Phase Three"), and is followed by _[Doctor Strange](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Doctor\_Strange\_(2016\_film) "Doctor Strange (2016 film)")_ (2016), _[Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Guardians\_of\_the\_Galaxy\_Vol.\_2 "Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 2")_ (2017), _[Spider-Man: Homecoming](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spider-Man:_Homecoming "Spider-Man: Homecoming")_ (2017), _[Thor: Ragnarok](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thor:_Ragnarok "Thor: Ragnarok")_ (2017), _[Black Panther](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Black\_Panther\_(film) "Black Panther (film)")_ (2018), _[Avengers: Infinity War](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity\_War "Avengers: Infinity War")_ (2018), _[Ant-Man and the Wasp](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ant-Man\_and\_the\_Wasp "Ant-Man and the Wasp")_ (2018), _[Captain Marvel](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Captain\_Marvel\_(film) "Captain Marvel (film)")_ (2019), _[Avengers: Endgame](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Endgame "Avengers: Endgame")_ (2019), and _[Spider-Man: Far From Home](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spider-Man:_Far\_From\_Home "Spider-Man: Far From Home")_ (2019).[[13]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-DigitalSpyPhases-13)
triples.statement: Phase Three begins with Captain America: Civil War (2016) and is followed by Doctor Strange (2016), Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 2 (2017), Spider-Man: Homecoming (2017), Thor: Ragnarok (2017), Black Panther (2018), Avengers: Infinity War (2018), Ant-Man and the Wasp (2018), Captain Marvel (2019), Avengers: Endgame (2019), and Spider-Man: Far From Home (2019).

section_body:
Further information: [Marvel Cinematic Universe: Phase Four](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe:_Phase_Four "Marvel Cinematic Universe: Phase Four"), [Phase Five](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe:_Phase_Five "Marvel Cinematic Universe: Phase Five"), and [Phase Six](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe:_Phase_Six "Marvel Cinematic Universe: Phase Six")

The second three phases are collectively known as "The Multiverse Saga", and include television series on [Disney+](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Disney%2B "Disney+").[[36]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-SDCC2022-36)[Phase Four](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe:_Phase_Four "Marvel Cinematic Universe: Phase Four") includes _[Black Widow](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Black\_Widow\_(2021\_film) "Black Widow (2021 film)")_ (2021), _[Shang-Chi and the Legend of the Ten Rings](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shang-Chi\_and\_the\_Legend\_of\_the\_Ten\_Rings "Shang-Chi and the Legend of the Ten Rings")_ (2021), _[Eternals](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eternals\_(film) "Eternals (film)")_ (2021), _[Spider-Man: No Way Home](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spider-Man:\_No\_Way\_Home "Spider-Man: No Way Home")_ (2021), _[Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Doctor\_Strange\_in\_the\_Multiverse\_of\_Madness "Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness")_ (2022), _[Thor: Love and Thunder](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thor:\_Love\_and\_Thunder "Thor: Love and Thunder")_ (2022), and _[Black Panther: Wakanda Forever](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Black\_Panther:\_Wakanda\_Forever "Black Panther: Wakanda Forever")_ (2022). [Phase Five](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe:_Phase_Five "Marvel Cinematic Universe: Phase Five") includes _[Ant-Man and the Wasp: Quantumania](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ant-Man\_and\_the\_Wasp:\_Quantumania "Ant-Man and the Wasp: Quantumania")_ (2023), _[Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 3](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Guardians\_of\_the\_Galaxy\_Vol.\_3 "Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 3")_ (2023), _[The Marvels](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The\_Marvels "The Marvels")_ (2023), _[Deadpool & Wolverine](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Deadpool\_%26\_Wolverine "Deadpool & Wolverine")_ (2024), _[Captain America: Brave New World](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Captain\_America:\_Brave\_New\_World "Captain America: Brave New World")_ (2025), and _[Thunderbolts*](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thunderbolts* "Thunderbolts*")_ (2025). [Phase Six](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe:_Phase_Six "Marvel Cinematic Universe: Phase Six") includes _[The Fantastic Four: First Steps](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The\_Fantastic\_Four:\_First\_Steps "The Fantastic Four: First Steps")_ (2025), _[Spider-Man: Brand New Day](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spider-Man:\_Brand\_New\_Day "Spider-Man: Brand New Day")_ (2026), _[Avengers: Doomsday](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:\_Doomsday "Avengers: Doomsday")_ (2026), and _[Avengers: Secret Wars](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:\_Secret\_Wars "Avengers: Secret Wars")_ (2027).[[13]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-DigitalSpyPhases-13)

triples.sentence: The second three phases are collectively known as "The Multiverse Saga", and include television series on [Disney+](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Disney%2B "Disney+").[[36]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-SDCC2022-36)
triples.statement: The second three phases of the Marvel Cinematic Universe are collectively known as "The Multiverse Saga" and include television series on Disney+.

triples.sentence: [Phase Six](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe:_Phase_Six "Marvel Cinematic Universe: Phase Six") includes _[The Fantastic Four: First Steps](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The\_Fantastic\_Four:\_First\_Steps "The Fantastic Four: First Steps")_ (2025), _[Spider-Man: Brand New Day](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spider-Man:\_Brand\_New\_Day "Spider-Man: Brand New Day")_ (2026), _[Avengers: Doomsday](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:\_Doomsday "Avengers: Doomsday")_ (2026), and _[Avengers: Secret Wars](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:\_Secret\_Wars "Avengers: Secret Wars")_ (2027).[[13]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-DigitalSpyPhases-13)
triples.statement: Phase Six includes the films The Fantastic Four: First Steps (2025), Spider-Man: Brand New Day (2026), Avengers: Doomsday (2026), and Avengers: Secret Wars (2027).

section_body:
Further information: [Marvel's ABC television series](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel%27s_ABC_television_series "Marvel's ABC television series"), [Marvel's Netflix television series](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel%27s_Netflix_television_series "Marvel's Netflix television series"), [Marvel's young adult television series](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel%27s_young_adult_television_series "Marvel's young adult television series"), and [Adventure into Fear (franchise)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Adventure_into_Fear_(franchise) "Adventure into Fear (franchise)")

[Marvel Television](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Television "Marvel Television") produced multiple television series set in the MCU across broadcast, streaming, and cable. Its [ABC](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/American_Broadcasting_Company "American Broadcasting Company") series included _[Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D.](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Agents\_of\_S.H.I.E.L.D. "Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D.")_ (2013–2020), _[Agent Carter](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Agent\_Carter\_(TV\_series) "Agent Carter (TV series)")_ (2015–2016), and _[Inhumans](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Inhumans\_(TV\_series) "Inhumans (TV series)")_ (2017); its [Netflix](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Netflix "Netflix") series included _[Daredevil](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Daredevil\_(TV\_series) "Daredevil (TV series)")_ (2015–2018), _[Jessica Jones](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jessica\_Jones\_(TV\_series) "Jessica Jones (TV series)")_ (2015–2019), _[Luke Cage](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Luke\_Cage\_(TV\_series) "Luke Cage (TV series)")_ (2016–2018), _[Iron Fist](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iron\_Fist\_(TV\_series) "Iron Fist (TV series)")_ (2017–2018), the crossover miniseries _[The Defenders](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The\_Defenders\_(miniseries) "The Defenders (miniseries)")_ (2017), and _[The Punisher](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The\_Punisher\_(TV\_series) "The Punisher (TV series)")_ (2017–2019); its young adult series included _[Runaways](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Runaways\_(TV\_series) "Runaways (TV series)")_ (2017–2019) streaming on [Hulu](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hulu "Hulu") and _[Cloak & Dagger](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cloak\_%26\_Dagger\_(TV\_series) "Cloak & Dagger (TV series)")_ (2018–2019) airing on [Freeform](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Freeform_(TV_channel) "Freeform (TV channel)"); and the Hulu series _[Helstrom](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Helstrom\_(TV\_series) "Helstrom (TV series)")_ (2020) was originally intended to be the start of a planned "Adventure into Fear" franchise,[[125]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-LoebAug2019-125) but was ultimately "not tied to the MCU", according to showrunner [Paul Zbyszewski](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paul_Zbyszewski "Paul Zbyszewski").[[126]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-HelstromNoMCU-126)

triples.sentence: Its [ABC](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/American_Broadcasting_Company "American Broadcasting Company") series included _[Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D.](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Agents_of_S.H.I.E.L.D. "Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D.")_ (2013–2020), _[Agent Carter](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Agent_Carter_(TV_series) "Agent Carter (TV series)")_ (2015–2016), and _[Inhumans](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Inhumans_(TV_series) "Inhumans (TV series)")_ (2017); its [Netflix](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Netflix "Netflix") series included _[Daredevil](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Daredevil_(TV_series) "Daredevil (TV series)")_ (2015–2018), _[Jessica Jones](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jessica_Jones_(TV_series) "Jessica Jones (TV series)")_ (2015–2019), _[Luke Cage](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Luke_Cage_(TV_series) "Luke Cage (TV series)")_ (2016–2018), _[Iron Fist](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iron_Fist_(TV_series) "Iron Fist (TV series)")_ (2017–2018), the crossover miniseries _[The Defenders](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Defenders_(miniseries) "The Defenders (miniseries)")_ (2017), and _[The Punisher](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Punisher_(TV_series) "The Punisher (TV series)")_ (2017–2019); its young adult series included _[Runaways](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Runaways_(TV_series) "Runaways (TV series)")_ (2017–2019) streaming on [Hulu](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hulu "Hulu") and _[Cloak & Dagger](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cloak_%26_Dagger_(TV_series) "Cloak & Dagger (TV series)")_ (2018–2019) airing on [Freeform](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Freeform_(TV_channel) "Freeform (TV channel)"); and the Hulu series _[Helstrom](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Helstrom_(TV_series) "Helstrom (TV series)")_ (2020) was originally intended to be the start of a planned "Adventure into Fear" franchise,[[125]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-LoebAug2019-125) but was ultimately "not tied to the MCU", according to showrunner [Paul Zbyszewski](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paul_Zbyszewski "Paul Zbyszewski").[[126]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-HelstromNoMCU-126)
triples.statement: Marvel Television's series included Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D., Agent Carter, and Inhumans on ABC; Daredevil, Jessica Jones, Luke Cage, Iron Fist, The Defenders, and The Punisher on Netflix; the young adult series Runaways on Hulu and Cloak & Dagger on Freeform; and the Hulu series Helstrom, which was ultimately not tied to the MCU despite initial plans for an "Adventure into Fear" franchise.

section_body:
Further information: [Marvel Cinematic Universe: Phase Four §Television series](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe:_Phase_Four#Television_series "Marvel Cinematic Universe: Phase Four"), [Phase Five § Television series](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe:_Phase_Five#Television_series "Marvel Cinematic Universe: Phase Five"), [Phase Six § Television series](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe:_Phase_Six#Television_series "Marvel Cinematic Universe: Phase Six"), and [Marvel Studios Special Presentations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Studios_Special_Presentations "Marvel Studios Special Presentations")

Beginning with Phase Four, television series were included as part of the Phases in addition to their feature films. Each series is released on Disney+. Phase Four includes the series _[WandaVision](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/WandaVision "WandaVision")_ (2021), _[The Falcon and the Winter Soldier](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The\_Falcon\_and\_the\_Winter\_Soldier "The Falcon and the Winter Soldier")_ (2021), the [first season](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Loki_season_1 "Loki season 1") of _[Loki](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Loki\_(TV\_series) "Loki (TV series)")_ (2021), the [first season](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/What_If...%3F_season_1 "What If...? season 1") of the animated series _[What If...?](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/What\_If...%3F\_(TV\_series) "What If...? (TV series)")_ (2021), _[Hawkeye](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hawkeye\_(miniseries) "Hawkeye (miniseries)")_ (2021), _[Moon Knight](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Moon\_Knight\_(miniseries) "Moon Knight (miniseries)")_ (2022), _[Ms. Marvel](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ms.\_Marvel\_(miniseries) "Ms. Marvel (miniseries)")_ (2022), and _[She-Hulk: Attorney at Law](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/She-Hulk:\_Attorney\_at\_Law "She-Hulk: Attorney at Law")_ (2022). The television specials _[Werewolf by Night](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Werewolf\_by\_Night\_(TV\_special) "Werewolf by Night (TV special)")_ (2022) and _[The Guardians of the Galaxy Holiday Special](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The\_Guardians\_of\_the\_Galaxy\_Holiday\_Special "The Guardians of the Galaxy Holiday Special")_ (2022) are also included in the phase. Phase Five includes _[Secret Invasion](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Secret\_Invasion\_(miniseries) "Secret Invasion (miniseries)")_ (2023), the [second season](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Loki_season_2 "Loki season 2") of _Loki_ (2023), the [second season](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/What_If...%3F_season_2 "What If...? season 2") of _What If...?_ (2023), _[Echo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Echo\_(miniseries) "Echo (miniseries)")_ (2024), _[Agatha All Along](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Agatha\_All\_Along "Agatha All Along")_ (2024), the [third season](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/What_If...%3F_season_3 "What If...? season 3") of _What If...?_ (2024), the [first season](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Your_Friendly_Neighborhood_Spider-Man_season_1 "Your Friendly Neighborhood Spider-Man season 1") of the animated series _[Your Friendly Neighborhood Spider-Man](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Your\_Friendly\_Neighborhood\_Spider-Man "Your Friendly Neighborhood Spider-Man")_ (2025), the [first season](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Daredevil:_Born_Again_season_1 "Daredevil: Born Again season 1") of _[Daredevil: Born Again](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Daredevil:\_Born\_Again "Daredevil: Born Again")_ (2025), and _[Ironheart](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ironheart\_(miniseries) "Ironheart (miniseries)")_ (2025). Phase Six includes the animated miniseries _[Eyes of Wakanda](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eyes\_of\_Wakanda "Eyes of Wakanda")_ (2025) and _[Marvel Zombies](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel\_Zombies\_(miniseries) "Marvel Zombies (miniseries)")_ (2025), _[Wonder Man](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wonder\_Man\_(miniseries) "Wonder Man (miniseries)")_ (2026), the [second](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Daredevil:_Born_Again_season_2 "Daredevil: Born Again season 2") and [third seasons](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Daredevil:_Born_Again_season_3 "Daredevil: Born Again season 3") of _Born Again_ (2026–27), and _[VisionQuest](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/VisionQuest "VisionQuest")_ (2026).[[13]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-DigitalSpyPhases-13)[[127]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-DDBAS3Release-127) An [untitled Punisher television special](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Untitled_Punisher_television_special "Untitled Punisher television special") (2026) is also expected to be released during the phase.[[128]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-PunisherSpecialRelease-128)

triples.sentence: Phase Six includes the animated miniseries _[Eyes of Wakanda](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eyes_of_Wakanda "Eyes of Wakanda")_ (2025) and _[Marvel Zombies](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Zombies_(miniseries) "Marvel Zombies (miniseries)")_ (2025), _[Wonder Man](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wonder_Man_(miniseries) "Wonder Man (miniseries)")_ (2026), the [second](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Daredevil:_Born_Again_season_2 "Daredevil: Born Again season 2") and [third seasons](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Daredevil:_Born_Again_season_3 "Daredevil: Born Again season 3") of _Born Again_ (2026–27), and _[VisionQuest](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/VisionQuest "VisionQuest")_ (2026).[[13]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-DigitalSpyPhases-13)[[127]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-DDBAS3Release-127)
triples.statement: Phase Six includes the animated miniseries Eyes of Wakanda (2025) and Marvel Zombies (2025), Wonder Man (2026), the second and third seasons of Born Again (2026–27), and VisionQuest (2026).

triples.sentence: An [untitled Punisher television special](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Untitled_Punisher_television_special "Untitled Punisher television special") (2026) is also expected to be released during the phase.[[128]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-PunisherSpecialRelease-128)
triples.statement: An untitled Punisher television special is also expected to be released in 2026 during Phase Six.

section_body:
Main articles: [Marvel One-Shots](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_One-Shots "Marvel One-Shots") and [_Team Thor_](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Team_Thor "Team Thor")

[Marvel One-Shots](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_One-Shots "Marvel One-Shots") are a series of [direct-to-video](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Direct-to-video "Direct-to-video")[short films](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Short_film "Short film") that are included as special features in the MCU films' [Blu-ray](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Blu-ray_Disc "Blu-ray Disc") and [digital distribution](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Digital_distribution "Digital distribution") releases. The films included _[The Consultant](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The\_Consultant\_(film) "The Consultant (film)")_ (2011), _[A Funny Thing Happened on the Way to Thor's Hammer](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A\_Funny\_Thing\_Happened\_on\_the\_Way\_to\_Thor%27s\_Hammer "A Funny Thing Happened on the Way to Thor's Hammer")_ (2011),[[94]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-OneShotsAnnouncement-94)_[Item 47](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Item\_47 "Item 47")_ (2012),[[129]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-Item47-129)_[Agent Carter](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Agent\_Carter\_(film) "Agent Carter (film)")_ (2013),[[130]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-CBRCarter-130) and _[All Hail the King](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/All\_Hail\_the\_King "All Hail the King")_ (2014).[[131]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-AHTK-131)

Following the One-Shots becoming available on Disney+ in January 2022, Marvel classified the _[Team Thor](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Team\_Thor "Team Thor")_[mockumentary](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mockumentary "Mockumentary") shorts as One-Shots.[[132]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-OneShotsD+Release-132)[[133]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-TeamThorOneShots-133)[[134]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-TeamThorOneShotsD+Tweet-134)_Team Thor_ is a series of direct-to-video mockumentary short films that were released from 2016 to 2018, consisting of _Team Thor_, _Team Thor: Part 2_, and _Team Darryl_, all written and directed by [Taika Waititi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Taika_Waititi "Taika Waititi").[[135]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-TeamThor-135)[[136]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-TeamThorPart2-136)[[137]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-TeamDarryl-137)

triples.sentence: The films included _[The Consultant](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The\_Consultant\_(film) "The Consultant (film)")_ (2011), _[A Funny Thing Happened on the Way to Thor's Hammer](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A\_Funny\_Thing\_Happened\_on\_the\_Way\_to\_Thor%27s\_Hammer "A Funny Thing Happened on the Way to Thor's Hammer")_ (2011),[[94]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-OneShotsAnnouncement-94)_[Item 47](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Item\_47 "Item 47")_ (2012),[[129]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-Item47-129)_[Agent Carter](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Agent\_Carter\_(film) "Agent Carter (film)")_ (2013),[[130]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-CBRCarter-130) and _[All Hail the King](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/All\_Hail\_the\_King "All Hail the King")_ (2014).[[131]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-AHTK-131)
triples.statement: The Marvel One-Shots films include The Consultant (2011), A Funny Thing Happened on the Way to Thor's Hammer (2011), Item 47 (2012), Agent Carter (2013), and All Hail the King (2014).

triples.sentence: Following the One-Shots becoming available on Disney+ in January 2022, Marvel classified the _[Team Thor](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Team\_Thor "Team Thor")_[mockumentary](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mockumentary "Mockumentary") shorts as One-Shots.[[132]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-OneShotsD+Release-132)[[133]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-TeamThorOneShots-133)[[134]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-TeamThorOneShotsD+Tweet-134)
triples.statement: After the One-Shots became available on Disney+ in January 2022, Marvel classified the Team Thor mockumentary shorts as One-Shots.

triples.sentence: _Team Thor_ is a series of direct-to-video mockumentary short films that were released from 2016 to 2018, consisting of _Team Thor_, _Team Thor: Part 2_, and _Team Darryl_, all written and directed by [Taika Waititi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Taika_Waititi "Taika Waititi").[[135]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-TeamThor-135)[[136]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-TeamThorPart2-136)[[137]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-TeamDarryl-137)
triples.statement: The Team Thor series, written and directed by Taika Waititi, is a series of direct-to-video mockumentary shorts released from 2016 to 2018, and consists of Team Thor, Team Thor: Part 2, and Team Darryl.

section_body:
Main article: [_I Am Groot_](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/I_Am_Groot "I Am Groot")

_I Am Groot_ is a series of [photorealistic](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Photorealism "Photorealism") animated short films for Disney+ starring [Baby Groot](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Baby_Groot_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Baby Groot (Marvel Cinematic Universe)") going on adventures with new and unusual characters.[[102]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-IAmGroot-102)[[103]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-DisneyInvestorDayVerge-103)[[104]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-IAmGrootPhotoreal-104)[Vin Diesel](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vin_Diesel "Vin Diesel") reprises his role, with five shorts releasing on August 10, 2022.[[138]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-IAmGrootRelease-138) A second season with five additional shorts was released on September 6, 2023.[[139]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-IAmGrootS2Release-139)

triples.sentence: [Vin Diesel](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vin_Diesel "Vin Diesel") reprises his role, with five shorts releasing on August 10, 2022.[[138]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-IAmGrootRelease-138)
triples.statement: Vin Diesel reprises his role in the series, which released five shorts on August 10, 2022.

triples.sentence: A second season with five additional shorts was released on September 6, 2023.[[139]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-IAmGrootS2Release-139)
triples.statement: A second season with five additional shorts was released on September 6, 2023.

section_body:
_[WHIH Newsfront](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/WHIH\_Newsfront "WHIH Newsfront")_ (2015–16) is an in-universe current affairs show that serves as a [viral marketing](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Viral_marketing "Viral marketing") campaign for some of the MCU films, created in partnership with Google for [YouTube](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/YouTube "YouTube").[[98]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-WHIHPromo-98)[[140]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-BibbReveal-140) The campaign is an extension of the fictional news network WHIH World News, which is seen reporting on major events in many MCU films and television series.[[141]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-WHIHWorldNews-141)[Leslie Bibb](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leslie_Bibb "Leslie Bibb") reprises her role as [Christine Everhart](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Christine_Everhart_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Christine Everhart (Marvel Cinematic Universe)") from the _Iron Man_ films.[[140]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-BibbReveal-140)

_[Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D.: Slingshot](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Agents\_of\_S.H.I.E.L.D.:\_Slingshot "Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D.: Slingshot")_ (2016) is one of several [_Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D._ web series](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Agents_of_S.H.I.E.L.D._web_series "Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D. web series") created for [ABC.com](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ABC.com "ABC.com") and produced by Marvel Television that is a supplement to _Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D._, with the main cast reprising their roles.[[99]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-Slingshot-99)

The first two seasons of _[The Daily Bugle](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The\_Daily\_Bugle\_(web\_series) "The Daily Bugle (web series)")_ (2019–2022) are an in-universe current affairs show serving as a viral marketing campaign for the films _Spider-Man: Far From Home_ and _Spider-Man: No Way Home_, with the videos released on YouTube and [TikTok](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/TikTok "TikTok"). It is based on the fictional sensationalist news outlet [of the same name](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/TheDailyBugle.net "TheDailyBugle.net") that appears in the MCU—itself based on the fictional newspaper agency [of the same name](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Daily_Bugle "Daily Bugle") appearing in several [Marvel Comics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Comics "Marvel Comics") publications. [J. K. Simmons](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._K._Simmons "J. K. Simmons") and [Angourie Rice](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Angourie_Rice "Angourie Rice") reprise their roles as [J. Jonah Jameson](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._Jonah_Jameson_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "J. Jonah Jameson (Marvel Cinematic Universe)") and [Betty Brant](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Betty_Brant_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Betty Brant (Marvel Cinematic Universe)") from the _Spider-Man_ films.[[142]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-DailyBugleTikTok-142)

triples.sentence: The campaign is an extension of the fictional news network WHIH World News, which is seen reporting on major events in many MCU films and television series.[[141]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-WHIHWorldNews-141)
triples.statement: The campaign is an extension of the fictional news network WHIH World News, which reports on major events in many MCU films and television series.

triples.sentence: _[Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D.: Slingshot](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Agents_of_S.H.I.E.L.D.:_Slingshot "Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D.: Slingshot")_ (2016) is one of several [_Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D._ web series](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Agents_of_S.H.I.E.L.D._web_series "Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D. web series") created for [ABC.com](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ABC.com "ABC.com") and produced by Marvel Television that is a supplement to _Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D._, with the main cast reprising their roles.[[99]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-Slingshot-99)
triples.statement: Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D.: Slingshot (2016) is a supplemental web series to Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D., created for ABC.com by Marvel Television, with the main cast reprising their roles.

triples.sentence: [J. K. Simmons](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._K._Simmons "J. K. Simmons") and [Angourie Rice](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Angourie_Rice "Angourie Rice") reprise their roles as [J. Jonah Jameson](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._Jonah_Jameson_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "J. Jonah Jameson (Marvel Cinematic Universe)") and [Betty Brant](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Betty_Brant_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Betty Brant (Marvel Cinematic Universe)") from the _Spider-Man_ films.[[142]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-DailyBugleTikTok-142)
triples.statement: J. K. Simmons and Angourie Rice reprise their roles as J. Jonah Jameson and Betty Brant from the Spider-Man films.

section_body:
Main article: [Marvel Cinematic Universe tie-in comics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe_tie-in_comics "Marvel Cinematic Universe tie-in comics")

Multiple [limited series](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Limited_series_(comics) "Limited series (comics)") or [one-shot](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/One-shot_(comics) "One-shot (comics)") comic books that tie into the MCU films and television series have been published by Marvel Comics. They are intended to tell additional stories about existing characters or to make connections between MCU projects, without necessarily expanding the universe or introducing new concepts or characters.[[92]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-IM2comics-92)[[143]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-TieInComics2-143)

triples.sentence: They are intended to tell additional stories about existing characters or to make connections between MCU projects, without necessarily expanding the universe or introducing new concepts or characters.[[92]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-IM2comics-92)[[143]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-TieInComics2-143)
triples.statement: The tie-in comics are intended to tell additional stories about existing characters or connect MCU projects, without necessarily expanding the universe or introducing new concepts or characters.

section_body:
For books written about the MCU, see [§Literary material](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#Literary_material) below.

_The Wakanda Files: A Technological Exploration of the Avengers and Beyond_ is "a collection of papers, articles, blueprints, and notes amassed throughout history by Wakanda's War Dogs" at the request of [Shuri](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shuri_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Shuri (Marvel Cinematic Universe)"). It is organized by areas of study and covers the technological advancements throughout the MCU. The book, which exists within the universe, was written by Troy Benjamin and published by Epic Ink and Quarto Publishing Group. _The Wakanda Files_ has content printed with UV ink that can be viewed with Kimoyo bead–shaped UV lights included with the book. It was released on October 20, 2020.[[144]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-WakandaFiles-144)

_[Look Out for the Little Guy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Look\_Out\_for\_the\_Little\_Guy "Look Out for the Little Guy")_, the fictional memoir written by [Scott Lang](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scott_Lang_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Scott Lang (Marvel Cinematic Universe)") as seen in _Ant-Man and the Wasp: Quantumania_, was released by [Hyperion Avenue](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Disney_Publishing_Worldwide "Disney Publishing Worldwide") on September 5, 2023. It was created alongside Marvel Studios and the _Quantumania_ filmmakers,[[145]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-LookOutForTheLittleGuy-145) and was written by [Rob Kutner](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rob_Kutner "Rob Kutner"),[[146]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-LoftLGAuthors-146) featuring "over 20 short pieces exploring different aspects of Scott's experiences" as a father and Avenger.[[145]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-LookOutForTheLittleGuy-145)_Quantumania_ writer [Jeff Loveness](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jeff_Loveness "Jeff Loveness") wrote the material from the memoir that was featured in the film.[[146]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-LoftLGAuthors-146)

triples.sentence: It was released on October 20, 2020.[[144]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-WakandaFiles-144)
triples.statement: The Wakanda Files was released on October 20, 2020.

triples.sentence: It was created alongside Marvel Studios and the _Quantumania_ filmmakers,[[145]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-LookOutForTheLittleGuy-145) and was written by [Rob Kutner](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rob_Kutner "Rob Kutner"),[[146]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-LoftLGAuthors-146) featuring "over 20 short pieces exploring different aspects of Scott's experiences" as a father and Avenger.[[145]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-LookOutForTheLittleGuy-145)
triples.statement: The book was created with Marvel Studios and the Quantumania filmmakers, written by Rob Kutner, and features over 20 short pieces about Scott Lang's experiences as a father and Avenger.

triples.sentence: _Quantumania_ writer [Jeff Loveness](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jeff_Loveness "Jeff Loveness") wrote the material from the memoir that was featured in the film.[[146]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-LoftLGAuthors-146)

section_body:
Main article: [Music of the Marvel Cinematic Universe](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Music_of_the_Marvel_Cinematic_Universe "Music of the Marvel Cinematic Universe")

Various composers have created the [film and television scores](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Film_score "Film score") of the MCU films, television series, One-Shots, Special Presentations, and other related projects of the MCU, primarily released by Marvel Studios's record label [Marvel Music](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Music_(record_label) "Marvel Music (record label)"). Original songs have also been created specifically for use in the franchise, while [Brian Tyler](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brian_Tyler "Brian Tyler") and [Michael Giacchino](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Michael_Giacchino "Michael Giacchino") have both scored [fanfares](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fanfares "Fanfares") for the Marvel Studios [production logo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Production_logo "Production logo").[[147]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-FanfareTyler-147)[[148]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-FanfareGiacchino-148)

triples.sentence: Original songs have also been created specifically for use in the franchise, while [Brian Tyler](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brian_Tyler "Brian Tyler") and [Michael Giacchino](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Michael_Giacchino "Michael Giacchino") have both scored [fanfares](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fanfares "Fanfares") for the Marvel Studios [production logo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Production_logo "Production logo").[[147]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-FanfareTyler-147)[[148]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-FanfareGiacchino-148)
triples.statement: Original songs have been created for the franchise, and both Brian Tyler and Michael Giacchino have scored fanfares for the Marvel Studios production logo.

section_body:
Main article: [Marvel Cinematic Universe timeline](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe_timeline "Marvel Cinematic Universe timeline")

The fictional timeline of the MCU includes the feature films, television series, television specials, short films, and the _I Am Groot_ shorts from Marvel Studios and Marvel Television's Netflix series. While the early films of Phase One and Phase Two of the franchise followed each other in the timeline similar to their release order, Phase Three saw many of the films overlapping with each other in the timeline, while also introducing the first prequel property, _Captain Marvel_. The Phase Three film _Avengers: Endgame_ featured characters traveling into the past and introduced a five-year time jump, with many subsequent releases in Phase Four and Phase Five set after _Endgame_'s events in the timeline. The television series _Loki_ and _What If...?_ were the first properties to occur outside of the main timeline and explore alternative timelines and universes.

There have been numerous attempts by Marvel Studios and others to codify the events of the MCU, which have been subject to perceived [continuity errors](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Continuity_errors "Continuity errors"), resulting in Marvel Studios releasing an official timeline book in 2023 for their first four phases that were designated as part of their "[Sacred Timeline](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sacred_Timeline "Sacred Timeline")". This book did not feature projects produced by other companies, such as Marvel Television's series, which were all loosely connected to the films; however, it was noted that all of these outside projects were part of the larger Marvel canon. In early 2024, Marvel Studios formally integrated Marvel Television's group of Netflix series into its Disney+ timeline.

As of the Phase Five television series _Daredevil: Born Again_ and the film _Thunderbolts*_, the "present day" in the MCU is 2027.[[149]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-DDBATimeline2-149)[[150]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-ThunderboltsTimeline-150) The following covers and discusses MCU media released by Marvel Studios and the Netflix series by Marvel Television. _Loki_ and _What If...?_ are excluded from the diagram because they occur outside of the main timeline. _Werewolf by Night_ is also excluded, given that the special explicitly does not indicate where it takes place in the MCU. Disney+'s timeline order places the first seasons of _Loki_ and _What If...?_ between _Avengers: Endgame_ and _WandaVision_, their second seasons after _The Marvels_, and _Werewolf by Night_ after _Thor: Love and Thunder_; _Werewolf by Night_ is also placed here in _[The Marvel Cinematic Universe: An Official Timeline](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The\_Marvel\_Cinematic\_Universe:\_An\_Official\_Timeline "The Marvel Cinematic Universe: An Official Timeline")_.

**Key**: 
*   Occurs on the MCU's Sacred Timeline 
*   Occurs outside the MCU's Sacred Timeline at a set timeframe
