section_body:
In September 2015, Marvel announced the _Guidebook to the Marvel Cinematic Universe_, named as a nod to the _[Official Handbook of the Marvel Universe](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Official\_Handbook\_of\_the\_Marvel\_Universe "Official Handbook of the Marvel Universe")_. Each guidebook is compiled by Mike O'Sullivan and the _Official Handbook of the Marvel Universe_ team, with cover art from [Mike del Mundo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mike_del_Mundo "Mike del Mundo") and Pascal Campion, and features facts about the MCU films, film-to-comic comparisons, and production stills. The guidebooks released each month from October 2015 to January 2016 were _Guidebook to the Marvel Cinematic Universe: Marvel's Iron Man_, _Guidebook to the Marvel Cinematic Universe: Marvel's Incredible Hulk / Marvel's Iron Man 2_,[[445]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-Guidebook-449)_Guidebook to the Marvel Cinematic Universe: Marvel's Thor_,[[446]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-GuidebookThor-450) and _Guidebook to the Marvel Cinematic Universe: Marvel's Captain America: The First Avenger_.[[447]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-GuidebookCapTFA-451)

In November 2018, Marvel and [Titan Publishing Group](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Titan_Publishing_Group "Titan Publishing Group") released _Marvel Studios: The First Ten Years_ to celebrate the first ten years of the MCU. It features cast interviews, in-depth sections on each film, and an Easter egg guide.[[448]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-TitanFirstTenYears-452) In October 2021, a two-volume book _The Story of Marvel Studios: The Making of the Marvel Cinematic Universe_ was released, written by Tara Bennett and Paul Terry. This collection features a look at the evolution of Marvel Studios, personal stories from the 23-film "Infinity Saga", and interviews with cast and crew members.[[449]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-MakingOfMCU-453)

In April 2023, [W. W. Norton & Company](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/W._W._Norton_%26_Company "W. W. Norton & Company") announced _MCU: The Reign of Marvel Studios_ by Joanna Robinson, Dave Gonzales, and [Gavin Edwards](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gavin_Edwards_(writer) "Gavin Edwards (writer)"),[[450]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-MCUReignOfMarvelStudios-454) for release on October 10, 2023.[[451]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-MCUReign/Film-455) The book presents an unauthorized look at "the rise and uncertain reign of the MCU, analyzing Marvel Studios' place as a major player in Hollywood and global pop culture" from Marvel Studios' inception, through events in early 2023, conducted through numerous interviews with those closely associated with the MCU. Norton approached the writers in 2019 to work on a book centered on the MCU. Robinson explained that the book was originally meant to be an oral history, until Disney was no longer enthused about the book's publication despite initially being open to it, and told current employees and former stars not to talk to the writers. The writers were able to supplement the interviews they were able to get with those from "cultural critics and comics experts" in addition to years of research. Robinson added that because of the long work put into the book, it was able to cover the studio's expansion to television on Disney+, as well as "this current state of what I like to call a 'wobble' in Marvel's long reign", and provide "a lot of answers about how we got here". Additionally, the book was not deterred by the then-recent firings of Alonso and Marvel Entertainment CEO [Ike Perlmutter](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ike_Perlmutter "Ike Perlmutter"), needing only "a few cosmetic tweaks to weave the whole story together" with Robinson explaining those firings "actually reinforced our sense that we really had captured the story of Marvel in both its triumphs and its stumbling blocks".[[450]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-MCUReignOfMarvelStudios-454) Robinson was able to interview many of the subjects while Gonazles did the majority of the book's research, with Edwards compiling it all to give the book a "flow".[[451]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-MCUReign/Film-455)

In February 2024, [Abrams Books](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Abrams_Books "Abrams Books") announced _Marvel Studios: The Art of Ryan Meinerding_, written by Bennett and Terry. The book includes over 500 of Meinerding's illustrations, from work-in-progress to completed pieces, along with interview material in which Meinerding discusses his process and his work in Marvel Studios' visual development department. It was released on October 1, 2024.[[452]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-MeinerdingBook-456)

triples.sentence: The guidebooks released each month from October 2015 to January 2016 were _Guidebook to the Marvel Cinematic Universe: Marvel's Iron Man_, _Guidebook to the Marvel Cinematic Universe: Marvel's Incredible Hulk / Marvel's Iron Man 2_,[[445]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-Guidebook-449)_Guidebook to the Marvel Cinematic Universe: Marvel's Thor_,[[446]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-GuidebookThor-450) and _Guidebook to the Marvel Cinematic Universe: Marvel's Captain America: The First Avenger_.[[447]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-GuidebookCapTFA-451)
triples.statement: From October 2015 to January 2016, guidebooks were released monthly covering "Iron Man," "Incredible Hulk / Iron Man 2," "Thor," and "Captain America: The First Avenger."

triples.sentence: It features cast interviews, in-depth sections on each film, and an Easter egg guide.[[448]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-TitanFirstTenYears-452)
triples.statement: The book "Marvel Studios: The First Ten Years" includes cast interviews, detailed sections on each film, and a guide to Easter eggs.

triples.sentence: This collection features a look at the evolution of Marvel Studios, personal stories from the 23-film "Infinity Saga", and interviews with cast and crew members.[[449]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-MakingOfMCU-453)
triples.statement: This collection examines the evolution of Marvel Studios, includes personal stories from the 23-film "Infinity Saga," and features interviews with cast and crew.

triples.sentence: In April 2023, [W. W. Norton & Company](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/W._W._Norton_%26_Company "W. W. Norton & Company") announced _MCU: The Reign of Marvel Studios_ by Joanna Robinson, Dave Gonzales, and [Gavin Edwards](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gavin_Edwards_(writer) "Gavin Edwards (writer)"),[[450]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-MCUReignOfMarvelStudios-454) for release on October 10, 2023.[[451]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-MCUReign/Film-455)
triples.statement: In April 2023, W. W. Norton & Company announced the book "MCU: The Reign of Marvel Studios" by Joanna Robinson, Dave Gonzales, and Gavin Edwards, with a release date of October 10, 2023.

triples.sentence: Additionally, the book was not deterred by the then-recent firings of Alonso and Marvel Entertainment CEO [Ike Perlmutter](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ike_Perlmutter "Ike Perlmutter"), needing only "a few cosmetic tweaks to weave the whole story together" with Robinson explaining those firings "actually reinforced our sense that we really had captured the story of Marvel in both its triumphs and its stumbling blocks".[[450]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-MCUReignOfMarvelStudios-454)
triples.statement: The recent firings of Alonso and CEO Ike Perlmutter did not deter the book's publication; Robinson explained that these events required only minor adjustments and reinforced the book's narrative about Marvel's successes and failures.

triples.sentence: Robinson was able to interview many of the subjects while Gonazles did the majority of the book's research, with Edwards compiling it all to give the book a "flow".[[451]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-MCUReign/Film-455)
triples.statement: For the book, Robinson conducted many interviews, Gonzales performed most of the research, and Edwards compiled the material to create a narrative flow.

triples.sentence: It was released on October 1, 2024.[[452]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-MeinerdingBook-456)
triples.statement: The book was released on October 1, 2024.

section_body: In February 2016, a commercial for [Coca-Cola](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Coca-Cola "Coca-Cola") mini cans aired during [Super Bowl 50](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Super_Bowl_50 "Super Bowl 50"). _A Mini Marvel_ was created by [Wieden+Kennedy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wieden%2BKennedy "Wieden+Kennedy") for Coca-Cola through a partnership with Marvel, and was directed by the Russo brothers.[[477]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-SuperBowl50Coke-481)[[478]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-SuperBowl50Coke2-482) In the ad, Ant-Man (voiced by Paul Rudd, reprising his role) and the Hulk first fight, and then bond, over a Coke mini can.[[477]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-SuperBowl50Coke-481)[Luma Pictures](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Luma_Pictures "Luma Pictures") provided visual effects for the spot, having worked previously with the two characters in MCU films. For the Hulk, Luma redefined its previous muscular system and simulation process to create and render the character, while Ant-Man received new motion capture.[[478]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-SuperBowl50Coke2-482) The Super Bowl campaign extended to "limited-edition Coke mini cans [six packs] that are emblazoned with images of Marvel characters, including Hulk, Ant-Man, Black Widow, [Falcon, Iron Man] and Captain America." Consumers had the opportunity to purchase the cans by finding hidden clues in the commercial, though "if the program goes well, Coke will consider making the cans available in stores."[[477]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-SuperBowl50Coke-481) The ad had the third most social media activity of all the film-related trailers that aired during the game,[[479]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-DeadlineCoke-483) and was nominated for Outstanding Visual Effects in a Commercial at the [15th Visual Effects Society Awards](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Visual_Effects_Society_Awards_2016 "Visual Effects Society Awards 2016").[[480]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-MiniMarvelVESA-484)

triples.sentence: _A Mini Marvel_ was created by [Wieden+Kennedy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wieden%2BKennedy "Wieden+Kennedy") for Coca-Cola through a partnership with Marvel, and was directed by the Russo brothers.[[477]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-SuperBowl50Coke-481)[[478]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-SuperBowl50Coke2-482)
triples.statement: The commercial, titled "A Mini Marvel," was created by Wieden+Kennedy for Coca-Cola in partnership with Marvel and was directed by the Russo brothers.

triples.sentence: In the ad, Ant-Man (voiced by Paul Rudd, reprising his role) and the Hulk first fight, and then bond, over a Coke mini can.[[477]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-SuperBowl50Coke-481)
triples.statement: In the ad, Ant-Man, voiced by a reprising Paul Rudd, and the Hulk fight and then bond over a Coke mini can.

triples.sentence: For the Hulk, Luma redefined its previous muscular system and simulation process to create and render the character, while Ant-Man received new motion capture.[[478]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-SuperBowl50Coke2-482)
triples.statement: For the commercial, Luma redefined its muscular system and simulation process for the Hulk, while Ant-Man received new motion capture.

triples.sentence: Consumers had the opportunity to purchase the cans by finding hidden clues in the commercial, though "if the program goes well, Coke will consider making the cans available in stores."[[477]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-SuperBowl50Coke-481)
triples.statement: Consumers could purchase the cans by finding hidden clues in the commercial, and Coca-Cola would consider making them available in stores if the program was successful.

triples.sentence: The ad had the third most social media activity of all the film-related trailers that aired during the game,[[479]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-DeadlineCoke-483) and was nominated for Outstanding Visual Effects in a Commercial at the [15th Visual Effects Society Awards](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Visual_Effects_Society_Awards_2016 "Visual Effects Society Awards 2016").[[480]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-MiniMarvelVESA-484)

section_path: _The Good, the Bart, and the Loki_
section_body:
Main article: [The Good, the Bart, and the Loki](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Good,_the_Bart,_and_the_Loki "The Good, the Bart, and the Loki")

In June 2021, _[The Simpsons](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The\_Simpsons "The Simpsons")_ short film _The Good, the Bart, and the Loki_ was announced, which was released alongside "[Journey into Mystery](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Journey_into_Mystery_(Loki) "Journey into Mystery (Loki)")", the fifth episode of _Loki_ on Disney+. The short sees Loki teaming up with [Bart Simpson](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bart_Simpson "Bart Simpson") in a crossover that pays homage to the heroes and villains of the MCU. Hiddleston reprises his role as Loki in the short.[[481]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-SimpsonsShort-485)

triples.sentence: Hiddleston reprises his role as Loki in the short.[[481]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe#cite_note-SimpsonsShort-485)
triples.statement: Hiddleston reprises his role as Loki in the short.
